prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Tapered End Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a tapered end. Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin with no rotation along any axis. Sketch for Face 1 Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 1. Create the first line segment starting at (0, 0.118) and ending at (0.6054, 0). 2. Create the second line segment starting at (0.6054, 0) and ending at (0.75, 0.0616). 3. Create the third line segment starting at (0.75, 0.0616) and ending at (0.75, 0.1232). 4. Create the fourth line segment starting at (0.75, 0.1232) and ending at (0, 0.1232). 5. Create the fifth line segment starting at (0, 0.1232) and ending at (0, 0.118). Close the loop and complete the sketch. Extrusion Extrude the sketch in the normal direction by 0.1607 units. Apply a scale factor of 0.75 to the sketch before extrusion. Part 2: Rectangular Prism with a Triangular Cutout Construct a CAD model of a rectangular prism with a triangular cutout on one side. Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system at (0.6054, 0.1232, 0) with an euler angle of [0, 0, -90] around the Z-axis. Sketch for Face 1 Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. 1. Create the first line segment starting at (0, 0) and ending at (0.1446, 0). 2. Create the second line segment starting at (0.1446, 0) and ending at (0.1446, 0.0268). 3. Create the third line segment starting at (0.1446, 0.0268) and ending at (0, 0). Close the loop and complete the sketch. Sketch for Face 2 1. Create the first line segment starting at (0, 0.1607) and ending at (0.1446, 0.1339). 2. Create the second line segment starting at (0.1446, 0.1339) and ending at (0.1446, 0.1607). 3. Create the third line segment starting at (0.1446, 0.1607) and ending at (0, 0.1607). Close the loop and complete the sketch. Extrusion Extrude the sketch in the normal direction by 0.1339 units. Subtract this volume from the previously created part. The final CAD model consists of the assembled parts, forming a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, a slightly tapered shape, with the narrowest point at the top. The sides of the prism are parallel and meet at right angles.</description>
